intro: Diplecthrum bracteatum, commonly known as the bracteate thornapple, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some regions for decorative purposes.
